thread.title: Strong Plan Slam Dunk For Basketball | Mirage News
thread.title_full: Strong Plan Slam Dunk For Basketball | Mirage News

author: Mirage News
title: Strong Plan Slam Dunk For Basketball | Mirage News
text: Under our 2030 Strong Plan for Tasmania's Future, basketballers in northern Tassie are set to receive a slam dunk. Liberal Candidate for Bass, Rob Fairs said that basketball is a growing sport with more than 3,500 registered participants across 630 teams. "We know that lack of courts is one of the biggest barriers to Tasmanians playing basketball," Mr Fairs said. "This is why I am proud to announce that a re-elected majority Liberal Government will invest $21.5 million to reinvigorate the Elphin Sports Centre. "We want to see the nearly 4,000 games of community basketball played in Launceston each year supported and thriving. "We will do this by not only delivering an upgrade to Elphin - our $43.6 million development of the Hub at Mowbray will mean that even as Launceston grows our sports can keep up too. "Under our 2030 Strong Plan for Tasmania's Future we're going to keep supporting local sports by making sure that they have the facilities needed to play on!"
